org.apache.bookkeeper.meta

Interface LedgerManager

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AutoCloseable, Closeable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractHierarchicalLedgerManager, AbstractZkLedgerManager, CleanupLedgerManager, FlatLedgerManager, HierarchicalLedgerManager, LegacyHierarchicalLedgerManager, LongHierarchicalLedgerManager, MSLedgerManagerFactory.MsLedgerManager

    public interface LedgerManager
extends Closeable
    LedgerManager takes responsibility of ledger management in client side.
    • How to store ledger meta (e.g. in ZooKeeper or other key/value store)

    • Method Detail

      • createLedgerMetadata

        void createLedgerMetadata(long ledgerId,
                          LedgerMetadata metadata,
                          org.apache.bookkeeper.proto.BookkeeperInternalCallbacks.GenericCallback<Void> cb)
        Create a new ledger with provided ledger id and metadata
        Parameters:
        ledgerId - Ledger id provided to be created
        metadata - Metadata provided when creating the new ledger
        cb - Callback when creating a new ledger. Return code:
        • BKException.Code.OK if success
        • BKException.Code.LedgerExistException if given ledger id exist
        • BKException.Code.ZKException/BKException.Code.MetaStoreException for other issue

      • removeLedgerMetadata

        void removeLedgerMetadata(long ledgerId,
                          org.apache.bookkeeper.versioning.Version version,
                          org.apache.bookkeeper.proto.BookkeeperInternalCallbacks.GenericCallback<Void> vb)
        Remove a specified ledger metadata by ledgerId and version.
        Parameters:
        ledgerId - Ledger Id
        version - Ledger metadata version
        cb - Callback when remove ledger metadata. Return code:
        • BKException.Code.OK if success
        • BKException.Code.MetadataVersionException if version doesn't match
        • BKException.Code.NoSuchLedgerExistsException if ledger not exist
        • BKException.Code.ZKException for other issue

      • readLedgerMetadata

        void readLedgerMetadata(long ledgerId,
                        org.apache.bookkeeper.proto.BookkeeperInternalCallbacks.GenericCallback<LedgerMetadata> readCb)
        Read ledger metadata of a specified ledger.
        Parameters:
        ledgerId - Ledger Id
        readCb - Callback when read ledger metadata. Return code:
        • BKException.Code.OK if success
        • BKException.Code.NoSuchLedgerExistsException if ledger not exist
        • BKException.Code.ZKException for other issue

      • writeLedgerMetadata

        void writeLedgerMetadata(long ledgerId,
                         LedgerMetadata metadata,
                         org.apache.bookkeeper.proto.BookkeeperInternalCallbacks.GenericCallback<Void> cb)
        Write ledger metadata.
        Parameters:
        ledgerId - Ledger Id
        metadata - Ledger Metadata to write
        cb - Callback when finished writing ledger metadata. Return code:
        • BKException.Code.OK if success
        • BKException.Code.MetadataVersionException if version in metadata doesn't match
        • BKException.Code.ZKException for other issue

      • registerLedgerMetadataListener

                                    org.apache.bookkeeper.proto.BookkeeperInternalCallbacks.LedgerMetadataListener listener)
        Register the ledger metadata listener on ledgerId.
        Parameters:

        listener - listener.

      • unregisterLedgerMetadataListener

                                      org.apache.bookkeeper.proto.BookkeeperInternalCallbacks.LedgerMetadataListener listener)

        listener - ledger metadata listener.

      • asyncProcessLedgers

        void asyncProcessLedgers(org.apache.bookkeeper.proto.BookkeeperInternalCallbacks.Processor<Long> processor,
                         org.apache.zookeeper.AsyncCallback.VoidCallback finalCb,
                         Object context,
                         int successRc,
                         int failureRc)
        Loop to process all ledgers.

          After all ledgers were processed, finalCb will be triggerred:
        • if all ledgers are processed done with OK, success rc will be passed to finalCb.
        • if some ledgers are prcoessed failed, failure rc will be passed to finalCb.

        Parameters:
        processor - Ledger Processor to process a specific ledger
        finalCb - Callback triggered after all ledgers are processed
        context - Context of final callback
        successRc - Success RC code passed to finalCb when callback
        failureRc - Failure RC code passed to finalCb when exceptions occured.

      • getLedgerRanges

        LedgerManager.LedgerRangeIterator getLedgerRanges()
        Loop to scan a range of metadata from metadata storage
        Returns:
        will return a iterator of the Ranges
